definition: camera (abbr. for 照相機|照相机[zhao4 xiang4 ji1])/at the opportune moment/as the circumstances allow
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to wait for the opportune moment before taking action (idiom)
to act according to the situation (idiom)

pinyin: dan1 jing4 fan3 guang1 xiang4 ji1

sentences.english: The best of America's skaters beamed for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 最佳美國的溜冰者爲照相機放光了。

sentences.english: How much are the three Kodaks?
sentences.chinese: 這三架柯達照相機要多少錢？

sentences.english: He angled the camera in the correct postion.
sentences.chinese: 他把照相機調到了適當的角度。

sentences.english: If you believe Sony it's still the best camera even without OIS.
sentences.chinese: 如果你相信索尼儘管沒有光學防抖仍然是最好的相機。

sentences.english: It's even been suggested that it could replace many dedicated point-and-shoot cameras.
sentences.chinese: 甚至還有人說，它可以取代許多專業的傻瓜相機。

sentences.english: Sam could not supply (to purchase) the camera he longed for for it was too expensive.
sentences.chinese: 薩姆買不起他極想要那種照相機，因爲那相機太貴了。

sentences.english: Sam could not supply (to purchase) the camera he longed for for it was too expensive.
sentences.chinese: 薩姆買不起他極想要那種照相機，因爲那相機太貴了。

sentences.english: This paper designs a new kind of self-timer system for the digital camera.
sentences.chinese: 文章設計了一種新型的數碼相機自拍系統。

sentences.english: With a digital camera, check the images as you shoot.
sentences.chinese: 如果是數碼相機，拍攝完就要檢查一下。

sentences.english: Draw the camera textured with selection wireframe and no background clearing.
sentences.chinese: 繪製帶紋理的相機，帶有選擇線框和無背景清除。

sentences.english: The initiation process is re-corded by a high speed rotating camera.
sentences.chinese: 引爆過程用高速轉鏡相機記錄。

sentences.english: The home-plate camera filmed through the backstop.
sentences.chinese: 家板相機拍攝，通過逆止。

sentences.english: A special camera mounted on a boom is swung into position above Corina's frontal lobe.
sentences.chinese: 一個特殊的相機被安裝在了科瑞娜大腦額葉的位置上。

sentences.english: All in-camera meters are reflected-light meters. Reflected-light meters are calibrated to show the appropriate exposure for "average" scenes.
sentences.chinese: 所有融合在照相機內的測光表都是反射式的。

sentences.english: Quickly take a picture with DC then hurry back to the warm cart.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙用數碼相機拍了張照片就鑽回了溫暖的車廂裏。

sentences.english: It has just come to our notice that the Japanese camera canon manufactured by seiki- kogaku, tokyo, is very popular.
sentences.chinese: 久聞東京精機光學廠生產的“佳能”照相機頗有名氣。

definition: camera lens/camera shot (in a movie etc)/scene
body of a vehicle or machine/fuselage of a plane
to take a photograph/photography/to shoot (a movie)
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
